summary.para: Audio player based on MCI.
MciAudioPlayer works only on Windows, since it uses winmm.dll and MCI commands.
MciAudioPlayer lets MCI do all the heavy-lifting with sound playback. It launches MCI command and just awaits for amount of time corresponding to the duration of a given segment.

summary.para: Represents PCM WAV container.

is essentially a constructor of signals in memory based on data from the WAV stream, and its lifetime is not synchronized with the stream whatsoever. is not intended to be a wrapper around the stream, or to acquire any resource (it doesn't affect the underlying stream). The synonym name of this class could be also WaveContainer.

summary.para: Gets the signal from container using indexing scheme based on channel type. Examples
summary.code:
waveFile[Channels.Left] -> waveFile.Signals[0]
waveFile[Channels.Right] -> waveFile.Signals[1] (if it exists)
waveFile[(Channels)2] -> waveFile.Signals[2] (if it exists)
waveFile[Channels.Average] -> returns channel-averaged (new) signal
waveFile[Channels.Interleave] -> returns interleaved (new) signal

member.param: Channel (left, right, interleave, sum, average, or ordinary index)

member.name: M:NWaves.FeatureExtractors.Base.FeaturePostProcessing.AddDeltas(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Single[]},System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Single[]},System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Single[]},System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Extends feature vectors with delta-features (1st and optionally 2nd order derivatives).
According to formula:
d_t = \frac{\sum_{n=1}^N n (c_{t+n} - c_{t-n})}{2 \sum_{n=1}^N n^2}
vectors should be introduced before and after input vectors for computations.
By default, these vectors will be created automatically and copied from the first and the last input vector.
They can also be specified explicitly in and parameters.
member.param: Sequence of feature vectors that will be extended
Sequence of feature vectors that will be prepended to for computations
Sequence of feature vectors that will be appended to for computations
Number of feature vectors before and after input for computations

member.name: M:NWaves.FeatureExtractors.Base.FeaturePostProcessing.Join(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Single[]}[])
member.summary: Joins (merges) feature vectors from different collections into one combined feature vector. For example, it can join 12 MFCC and 10 PLP coeffs into one 22-dimensional vector. Collections of feature vectors must have the same size and contain at least one vector.

summary.para: Represents Mel Frequency Cepstral Coefficients (MFCC) extractor.

Since so many variations of MFCC have been developed since 1980, this class is very general and allows customizing a lot of parameters:
filterbank (by default it's MFCC-FB24 HTK/Kaldi-style)
non-linearity type (logE, log10, decibel (librosa power_to_db analog), cubic root)
spectrum calculation type (power/magnitude normalized/not normalized)
DCT type (1,2,3,4 normalized or not): "1", "1N", "2", "2N", etc.
floor value for LOG-calculations (usually it's float.Epsilon; HTK default seems to be 1.0 and in librosa 1e-10 is used)

summary.para: follows MPEG-7 recommendations to evaluate the following features:
It's a flexible extractor that allows varying almost everything.
The difference between and is that former calculates spectral features from total energy in frequency BANDS while latter analyzes signal energy at particular frequencies (spectral bins).
Check FeatureSet and HarmonicSet to see the full list of supported features.

member.name: T:NWaves.FeatureExtractors.Options.AmsOptions
member.summary:
Defines properties for configuring . General contracts are:
Sampling rate must be positive number
Frame duration must be positive number
Hop duration must be positive number
Default values:
FrameDuration = 0.025
HopDuration = 0.01
Window = WindowType.Rectangular
ModulationFftSize = 64
ModulationHopSize = 4

member.name: T:NWaves.FeatureExtractors.Options.ChromaOptions
member.summary:
Defines properties for configuring . General contracts are:
Sampling rate must be positive number
Frame duration must be positive number
Hop duration must be positive number
Specific contracts are:
Number of chroma coefficients must be positive
Norm must be positive
Octave width must be positive
Default values:
FrameDuration = 0.025
HopDuration = 0.01
FeatureCount = 12
Window = WindowType.Hann
OctaveWidth = 2
CenterOctave = 5.0
Norm = 2
BaseC = true

member.name: T:NWaves.FeatureExtractors.Options.FeatureExtractorOptions
member.summary:
Defines basic properties for configuring feature extractors. General contracts are:
Sampling rate must be positive number
Frame duration must be positive number
Hop duration must be positive number
Default values:
FrameDuration = 0.025
HopDuration = 0.01
Window = WindowType.Rectangular

member.name: P:NWaves.FeatureExtractors.Options.FeatureExtractorOptions.FeatureCount
member.summary: Gets or sets number of features to extract (feature vector size).

member.name: P:NWaves.FeatureExtractors.Options.FeatureExtractorOptions.SamplingRate
member.summary: Gets or sets expected sampling rate of signals for analysis.

member.name: P:NWaves.FeatureExtractors.Options.FeatureExtractorOptions.FrameDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets length of analysis frame (duration in seconds). By default, 0.025 (25ms).

member.name: P:NWaves.FeatureExtractors.Options.FeatureExtractorOptions.HopDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets hop length (duration in seconds). By default, 0.01 (10ms).

member.name: P:NWaves.FeatureExtractors.Options.FeatureExtractorOptions.FrameSize
member.summary: Gets or sets size of analysis frame (number of samples). Has priority over . If it is not specified explicitly, then it is auto-computed from .

member.name: P:NWaves.FeatureExtractors.Options.FeatureExtractorOptions.HopSize
member.summary: Gets or sets hop size (number of samples). Has priority over . If it is not specified explicitly, then it is auto-computed from .

member.name: P:NWaves.FeatureExtractors.Options.FeatureExtractorOptions.PreEmphasis
member.summary: Gets or sets pre-emphasis filter coefficient.

member.name: P:NWaves.FeatureExtractors.Options.FeatureExtractorOptions.Window
member.summary: Gets or sets window function (by default, rectangular window, i.e. no windowing). In and its subclasses (MFCC, PLP, etc.) default window is Hamming.

member.name: T:NWaves.FeatureExtractors.Options.FilterbankOptions
member.summary:
Defines properties for configuring filterbank-based extractors (including MFCC, PLP, etc.). General contracts are:
Sampling rate must be positive number
Frame duration must be positive number
Hop duration must be positive number
Specific contracts are:
Filter bank size must be positive number or the entire filter bank must be specified (not null)
Default values:
FrameDuration = 0.025
HopDuration = 0.01
Window = WindowType.Hamming
FilterbankSize = 12 (acts as FeatureCount)
LowFrequency = 0
HighFrequency = 0 (i.e. it will be auto-computed as SamplingRate/2)
NonLinearity = NonLineriatyType.None
SpectrumType = SpectrumType.Power
LogFloor = 1.4e-45 (float epsilon)

member.name: T:NWaves.FeatureExtractors.Options.LpccOptions
member.summary:
Defines properties for configuring . General contracts are:
Sampling rate must be positive number
Frame duration must be positive number
Hop duration must be positive number
Specific contracts are:
FeatureCount must be positive mumber
LPC order must be positive mumber (usually, FeatureCount-1)
Default values:
FrameDuration = 0.025
HopDuration = 0.01
Window = WindowType.Rectangular
LifterSize = 22

member.name: P:NWaves.FeatureExtractors.Options.LpccOptions.LifterSize
member.summary: Gets or sets number of liftered coefficients (by default, 22).

member.name: T:NWaves.FeatureExtractors.Options.LpcOptions
member.summary:
Defines properties for configuring . General contracts are:
Sampling rate must be positive number
Frame duration must be positive number
Hop duration must be positive number
Specific contracts are:
LPC order must be positive mumber
Default values:
FrameDuration = 0.025
HopDuration = 0.01
FeatureCount = LPC order + 1 (auto-computed)
Window = WindowType.Rectangular

member.name: P:NWaves.FeatureExtractors.Options.LpcOptions.LpcOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets order of LPC. This property is required. It has priority over FeatureCount. FeatureCount will be autocomputed by as LpcOrder+1.

member.name: T:NWaves.FeatureExtractors.Options.MfccOptions
member.summary:
Defines properties for configuring . General contracts are:
Sampling rate must be positive number
Frame duration must be positive number
Hop duration must be positive number
Specific contracts are:
FeatureCount must be positive mumber
DCT type must have one of these values: "1", "2", "3", "4", "1N", "2N", "3N", "4N"
Filter bank size must be positive number or the entire filter bank must be specified (not null)
FeatureCount must not exceed filterbank size
Default values:
FrameDuration = 0.025
HopDuration = 0.01
Window = WindowType.Hamming
FilterbankSize = 24
LowFrequency = 0
HighFrequency = 0 (i.e. it will be auto-computed as SamplingRate/2)
DctType = "2N"
NonLinearity = NonLineriatyType.Log10
SpectrumType = SpectrumType.Power
LifterSize = 0 (no liftering)
LogFloor = 1.4e-45 (float epsilon)
LogEnergyFloor = 1.4e-45 (float epsilon)

member.name: P:NWaves.FeatureExtractors.Options.MfccOptions.LifterSize
member.summary: Gets or sets number of liftered coefficients (0, by default, i.e. there will be no liftering).

member.name: P:NWaves.FeatureExtractors.Options.MfccOptions.DctType
member.summary: Gets or sets DCT type (by default, it's normalized DCT-II, or "2N").

member.name: T:NWaves.FeatureExtractors.Options.MultiFeatureOptions
member.summary:
Defines properties for configuring multi-feature extractors. General contracts are:
Sampling rate must be positive number
Frame duration must be positive number
Hop duration must be positive number
Default values:
FrameDuration = 0.025
HopDuration = 0.01
Window = WindowType.Rectangular
FeatureList = "all"

member.name: T:NWaves.FeatureExtractors.Options.PitchOptions
member.summary:
Defines properties for configuring . General contracts are:
Sampling rate must be positive number
Frame duration must be positive number
Hop duration must be positive number
Specific contracts are:
HighFrequency must be greater than LowFrequency
Default values:
LowFrequency = 80 (Hz)
HighFrequency = 400 (Hz)

member.summary: Internal buffer for a signal spectrum at each step.

member.summary: Internal buffer for a signal spectrum grouped to frequency bands.

member.summary: Autocorrelation samples (computed as IDFT of power spectrum).

member.name: M:NWaves.FeatureExtractors.PlpExtractor.ProcessFrame(System.Single[],System.Single[])

summary.para: Computes PLP-RASTA feature vector in one frame.

General algorithm:
Apply window
Obtain power spectrum
Apply filterbank of bark bands (or mel bands)
[Optional] filter each component of the processed spectrum with a RASTA filter
Apply equal loudness curve
Apply nonlinearity (take cubic root)
Do LPC
Convert LPC to cepstrum
[Optional] lifter cepstrum

member.param: Features (one PLP feature vector) computed in the block

member.name: M:NWaves.FeatureExtractors.PlpExtractor.IsParallelizable
member.summary: Returns false in RASTA-filtering mode (i.e. if RASTA-coefficient is not 0), since in this case does not support parallelization. Returns true in all other cases.

summary.para: Creates thread-safe copy of the extractor for parallel computations.
Returns null if the extractor does not support parallelization.

member.name: M:NWaves.FeatureExtractors.PnccExtractor.ProcessFrame(System.Single[],System.Single[])

summary.para: Computes PNCC vector in one frame according to [Kim and Stern, 2016].

General algorithm:
Apply window
Obtain power spectrum
Apply gammatone filters (squared)
Medium-time processing (asymmetric noise suppression, temporal masking, spectral smoothing)
Apply nonlinearity
Do DCT-II (normalized)

member.param: Features (one PNCC feature vector) computed in the block

member.name: M:NWaves.Filters.Fda.DesignFilter.Fir(System.Int32,System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Int32,NWaves.Windows.WindowType)

summary.para: Designs FIR filter using frequency sampling method (works identical to firwin2 in sciPy and fir2 in MATLAB).
Note. By default, the FFT size is auto-computed. If it is set explicitly, then (fftSize/2 + 1) must exceed the filter order.
Note. Array of frequencies can be null. In this case the must be provided and size of gains array must be fftSize/2 + 1. Frequencies will be uniformly sampled on range [0..0.5].

member.param: Frequencies (frequency sampling points), each in range [0..0.5]
Filter gains at the frequency sampling points

member.name: T:NWaves.Filters.Fda.FilterBanks
member.summary:
Contains methods providing general shapes of filter banks:
triangular
rectangular
FIR bandpass (close to trapezoidal, slightly overlapping)
BiQuad bandpass
...and methods for obtaining the most widely used frequency bands:
Herz bands
Mel bands (HTK and Slaney)
Bark bands (uniform and Slaney)
Critical bands
ERB filterbank
Octaves (from MPEG-7)
Chroma

member.name: M:NWaves.Filters.Fda.FilterBanks.Chroma(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Generates chroma feature filter bank (slightly over-complicated to match librosa analog).
member.param: Number of chroma features (12 pitch classes by default)
Tuning deviation from A440 in fractions of a chroma bin
If octaveWidth=0, centerOctave is ignored. Otherwise, it's the center of Gaussian window
If octaveWidth=0, the shape is rectangular. Otherwise, it's the width of Gaussian window
Norm: 0 - no normalization, 1 - apply L1-norm, 2 - apply L2-norm
If baseC=true, the filter bank will start at 'C'. Otherwise, the filter bank will start at 'A'.

member.name: T:NWaves.Filters.MovingAverageRecursiveFilter
member.summary:
Provides fast recursive implementation of moving average filter:
y[n] = x[n] / N - x[n - N] / N + y[n - 1]
i.e.
b = [1/N, 0, 0, 0, 0, ... , 0, -1/N]
a = [1, -1]

The length of crossfade section will be calculated based on the sampling rate of the first signal.
Represents Cepstral Transform (CT):
1,2) and 3) are identical to MATLAB functions cceps, icceps and rceps, respectively.
operates on real-valued data.

member.summary: Internal array for real parts of spectrum.

member.summary: Internal array for imaginary parts of spectrum.

member.summary: Internal array for storing the unwrapped phase.

member.name: M:NWaves.Transforms.CepstralTransform.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Constructs cepstral transformer. If exceeds , FFT size will be recalculated as the nearest power of 2 to cepstrum size.

member.name: M:NWaves.Transforms.CepstralTransform.ComplexCepstrum(System.Single[],System.Single[],System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Evaluates complex cepstrum as:
Real{IFFT(log(abs(FFT(x)) + unwrapped_phase))}
member.returns: Circular delay (number of samples) added to

member.name: M:NWaves.Transforms.CepstralTransform.InverseComplexCepstrum(System.Single[],System.Single[],System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Evaluates inverse complex cepstrum of (removing samples).

member.name: M:NWaves.Transforms.CepstralTransform.PowerCepstrum(System.Single[],System.Single[],System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Evaluates power cepstrum as:
power_cepstrum = 4 * real_cepstrum ^ 2

member.name: M:NWaves.Transforms.CepstralTransform.PhaseCepstrum(System.Single[],System.Single[],System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Evaluates phase cepstrum as:
phase_cepstrum = (complex_cepstrum - reversed_complex_cepstrum) ^ 2

member.name: T:NWaves.Utils.Scale
member.summary:
Provides methods for
1) converting between different scales:
decibel
MIDI pitch
mel (HTK)
mel (Slaney)
bark1 (Traunmueller)
bark2 (Wang)
ERB
2) loudness weighting:
A-weighting
B-weighting
C-weighting
